formula: Recurrence relation: bernoulli(n+1)=a[n+1]-sum(binomial(n+1, r)*bernoulli(r)*a[n+2-r], r=1..n+1); a[0]=1. (p. 603 of the Howard reference). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 23 2005E.g.f. for fractions: x^2/2 / (e^x-1-x). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Nov 04 2009

prog: (Sage)def A006569_list(len):    f, R, C = 1, [1], [1]+[0]*(len-1)    for n in (1..len-1):        f *= n        for k in range(n, 0, -1):            C[k] = C[k-1] / (k+2)        C[0] = -sum(C[k] for k in (1..n))        R.append((C[0]*f).numerator())    return Rprint A006569_list(29) # _Peter Luschny_, Feb 20 2016
